results.title: The Little players: a film by Robin Lehman
results.brief_description: Introduces “The Little Players”, a five member puppet troupe created by Frank Peshka and Bill Murdock whose repertoire is drawn from Shakespeare, Oscar Wilde and Noel Coward.

results.title: The Little Mermaid (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Howard Ashman, John Musker and Ron Clements
results.brief_description: Mermaids are supposed to stay under the sea, but there was never a mermaid quite like Ariel. The headstrong teenager longs to be part of the magical world on land, much to the dismay of her father, King Triton. When she falls in love with a human Prince, Ariel looks to Ursula, a sea witch. With the help of her friends, Ariel must win her prince’s love in a thrilling race against time. This production of “The Little Mermaid” based on the fairytale by Hans Christian Andersen is full of dazzling animation.

results.title: The Little Mermaid
results.creator_credit: GG Communications, Prima Film and Tim Reid
results.brief_description: Marina, a mermaid princess, is so curious about the human world after saving the life of a handsome prince that through the magic of the witch of the sea, she turns herself into a beautiful young woman. She returns to the castle to find her prince but her problem is that she can no longer speak, so how can she convey her deep love for her beloved prince? “The little mermaid” commemorates the centenary of the death of Hans Christian Anderson as the world of the fantastic and incredible adventures of Maria unfolds with beautiful colour and music.

results.title: The Little Mermaid
results.creator_credit: Glen Keane, Walt Disney Animation Studios, John Musker and Ron Clements
results.brief_description: Mermaids are supposed to stay under the sea, but there was never a mermaid quite like Ariel. The headstrong teenager longs to be part of the magical world on land, much to the dismay of her father, King Triton. When she falls in love with a human Prince, Ariel looks to Ursula, a sea witch. With the help of her friends, Ariel must win her Prince’s love in a thrilling race against time. This production of “The Little Mermaid”, based on the fairytale by Hans Christian Andersen, is full of dazzling animation and is a treasure for all ages. Cast features the voices of Rene Auberjonois, Buddy hackett, Jason Marin, Christopher Daniel Barnes, Jodie Benson, Kenneth Mars.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glen Keane, Walt Disney Animation Studios, John Musker and Ron Clements
results.description:
The mermaid princess Ariel dreams of the surface world shimmering above the ocean. The passing ships churn waves of curiosity in their wake, and she spends her days collecting the trinkets that wash overboard with Flounder. Too bad her father, King Triton, forbids her to explore the surface, preferring she enchant their underwater subjects with her miraculous singing voice. Out of all the king’s daughters, Ariel’s voice is the most majestic, a fact that riles the sea witch Ursula.

When one of those passing ships catches fire, Ariel swims to the rescue, saving the charming Prince Eric from drowning. When he awakes, dreaming of the woman who saved him and not realising it was a mermaid, Ariels sees her opportunity to follow her dreams. The only problem are her fins; she can’t join Prince Eric above the ocean. Ursula offers a devil’s bargain that could solve all Ariel’s problems though, for a price.

Brimming with charming underwater characters, a headstrong princess and unforgettable musical numbers, The Little Mermaid is one of the most iconic movies of all time. Not only did it endear itself to audiences around the world, it helped usher in the Disney renaissance, an era of unparalleled critical and commercial success that led to Aladdin (1992), Beauty and the Beast (1991) and the The Lion King (1994).

The above concept sketch from legendary animator Glenn Keane demonstrates all of Ariel’s wide-eyed will and exuberance and serves as a prototype of a famous shot from the iconic song “Part of Your World”.
description_for_label:
The mermaid princess Ariel dreams of the surface world shimmering above the ocean. The passing ships churn waves of curiosity in their wake, and she spends her days collecting the trinkets that wash overboard with Flounder. Too bad her father, King Triton, forbids her to explore the surface, preferring she enchant their underwater subjects with her miraculous singing voice. Out of all the king’s daughters, Ariel’s voice is the most majestic, a fact that riles the sea witch Ursula.

When one of those passing ships catches fire, Ariel swims to the rescue, saving the charming Prince Eric from drowning. When he awakes, dreaming of the woman who saved him and not realising it was a mermaid, Ariels sees her opportunity to follow her dreams. The only problem are her fins; she can’t join Prince Eric above the ocean. Ursula offers a devil’s bargain that could solve all Ariel’s problems though, for a price.

Brimming with charming underwater characters, a headstrong princess and unforgettable musical numbers, The Little Mermaid is one of the most iconic movies of all time. Not only did it endear itself to audiences around the world, it helped usher in the Disney renaissance, an era of unparalleled critical and commercial success that led to Aladdin (1992), Beauty and the Beast (1991) and the The Lion King (1994).

The above concept sketch from legendary animator Glenn Keane demonstrates all of Ariel’s wide-eyed will and exuberance and serves as a prototype of a famous shot from the iconic song “Part of Your World”.

results.title: The Little men of Chromagnon = Les Bibites de Chromagnon
results.brief_description: An introduction for children to the primary colours and their combinations. Using animation the film shows little elf-like creatures making all the discoveries. They emerge from three circles painted red, yellow and blue. When they venture into a circle of another colour they find that they too change colour.

results.title: The Little Marsupials
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
This program that contains rare and sometimes unique footage of little marsupials, including the amazing Honey Possum. Includes footage of the Numbats which feed exclusively on termites. Rare and endangered, the Numbats are the subject of research sponsored by the World Wildlife Fund. Features the marsupial gliders and the rare Red-Tailed Wambenger.

results.title: The Little island
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams Films and Richard Williams
results.brief_description: An animated film exploring the potential for conflict between different views of life and its possible consequences. Three inhabitants of an island clash repeatedly over their respective devotion to the good, the true and the beautiful. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Little giraffe
results.brief_description: A charming cast of animated toys moves through a miniature town with comic inventiveness to seek first-aid for a sadly deflated toy giraffe at a gas station air pump.

results.title: The Little foxes
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Goldwyn Productions, Samuel Goldwyn, William Wyler and Orry-Kelly
results.brief_description: Based on the stage play by renown author Lillian Hellman, Bette Davis gives an extraordinary performance as Regina, an avaricious wife who will stop at nothing to outwit her brothers in controlling the family business. The cost of this greed results in the death of her ailing husband, Herbert Marshall and rejection by her daughter played by Teresa Wright. Nominated for nine Academy Awards, the acting in this production is flawless, and the story is filled with drama and suspense. The Hubbard family of the “Deep South” remain one of the most greedy and rapacious family’s bought to the screen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: RKO Radio Pictures, Goldwyn Productions, Samuel Goldwyn, William Wyler and Orry-Kelly

results.title: The Little engine that could
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of “The Little train that could” by Watty Piper, this classic children’s fable is about perseverance, self-motivation and teamwork. In a busy yard filled with hard-working locomotives of all kinds, a tiny engine named Tillie dreams of pulling a real train over the mountain beyond. Everyone tells her that she is too small to manage such a feat - but Tillie firmly believes in herself. One fateful day, the all-important Birthday Train loaded with magical toys breaks down and when none of the other engines will stop to help, Tillie hooks herself to the stranded train and starts up the steep, forbidding mountainside with the famous call” I think I can, I think I can”.
